events.name: GDG New Haven - Fun With Maps! (Markers And Directions)
events.description:
Good news, everyone. Tomorrow you'll be making a delivery to Ebola 9, the virus planet.

Oh, wait, wrong group... You guys are developers.... Well I still have good news for everyone. On January 27th (@ 6:30 PM) we will be hosting our 3rd Meteor Meetup, as well as kicking off our first Google Developer Group meetup.

Our focus will be based on mapping, which will essentially be us building a Meteor app that queries through a database of restaurants and find the highest rated and closest restaurants to where we are. We while Meteor is our primary platform, Mongo and Google Maps will be doing the most work for us for querying restaurants, displaying them on a map, and getting directions to them.

This should be fun, and we look forward to seeing you all on the 27th!﻿

events.name: GDG New Haven - Study Jams: Android for Beginners (1/3)
events.description:
Starting February we'll be hosting three Study Jams (in partnership with the A100 Community && Indie-Soft) with a focus in Android. As a community we will work through the “Android Development for Beginners” offered by Udacity. REGISTER FOR THE CLASS WITH THIS LINK https://www.udacity.com/account/affiliate/GoogleStudyJams BEFORE THE FIRST MEETUP!

Study Jams are community­ organized study groups around Google online developer courses. The goal is to support as many students as possible in completing the course, thereby raising the technical level of the community.

Attendance to all three events, completion of the Udacity course, as well as completion of the final project will earn participants a Google-offered Study Jams completion certificate as well as a discount on the Android Nanodegree upon course completion.

Links To Check Out

• Udacity Registration Link

• Google+ Community of Developers Around The World Taking In StudyJams

• GDG New Haven Google+ Page

• GDG New Haven MeetUp Page

• A100 Community MeetUp Page (Attend Study Halls To Meet Other Developers Who Can Help!)

events.description:

events.name: Angular2 (Crash Course)
events.description:
Hey you, yea you… Meteor, JavaScript, Angular 1 developer… Well do I have news for you!

“The times they are a changin’…” (Or at least according to Bob Dylan)

So it get the crash course on Angular 2, the new front end templating language for your Progressive Web Apps, so you can get out there and write better apps!

---------------------------------------------------------- 
6:30pm - Networking and Food/Drinks 
7:00pm - Featured Presentation 
7:45pm - Lightning Talks - a chance for anyone to share a project they've have been working hard on! 
8:00pm - Announcements 
8:15pm - The Playwright Pub - across from Checkmate's Office

events.name: Northeast Javascript Conference
events.description:
The Northeast JavaScript Conference will be the largest conference of its kind in the region, a must-attend event featuring top-flight speakers sharing their experience with JavaScript frameworks.

Join us for two days of amazing workshops, panel discussions and networking with your peers. The event starts 8am Thursday Sept. 15th and runs through 5pm Friday Sept. 16th , and be held at the Stamford Innovation Center in Downtown Stamford – just steps from Metro North Railroad!

JavaScript Conference website: (Registration required, from $230-$435)

http://www.northeastjsconference.com

events.name: Web Components and Web Apps using Polymer
events.description:
Web Components is set of W3C standards that provide new way of building UI components. It defines native capabilities to build modern, complex and reusable Web Components and Web Apps.

Polymer is a javascript library that abstracts some of the complexities of Web Component Specifications and help developers to build Web Components more easily. The Polymer project also maintains set of Web Components that can be used to build modern Web Apps.

In this session we will go over the concepts that make up Web Components and deep dive into building Web Components and Web Apps using Polymer.

Presentation by Srikanth Bhat

events.name: GCP Basics - Building And Deploying Your First App!
events.description: We will be covering deploying your first application to Google Container Platform. From Creating the Angular app, to packaging the image, and to finally deploying it to GCP.

events.name: TechDuels: AngularJS vs. ReactJS (Hosted By GDG NYC, READ DETAILS)
events.description:
THIS IS JUST A PLACEHOLDER FOR AWARENESS
Please register via the General Assembly Event site to get a ticket to the event.

https://generalassemb.ly/education/techduels-angularjs-vs-reactjs/new-york-city/35079

TICKET PRICES

Tickets are currently set for $10 (early-bird) with prices going up to $20 by the end of April. The price covers attendance and food/drinks at the event along with an opportunity to network with experts and industry players in this space.

ABOUT EVENT

Witness a battle between passionate engineers making their case as to which is the best Javascript framework. The battle between Javascript frameworks, Angular vs React will be the first debate of its kind for the application frameworks community. We are looking for awesome debaters who are passionate about their application frameworks. We will have 4 judges, and the audience will be the fifth. The Tech debaters will discuss why they feel their framework is better for the following areas: Use by companies, use by programmers and ease of implementation & scalability.

This event will allow Javascript experts to debate in a 2 vs 2 team style debate. These experts will need to know their topic, that of their opponent, present their case within set periods of time, and deliver their response in a way win over an audience of technical and non-technical guests.

events.name: Intro to Typescript
events.description:
Interested in speaking? Sign up here https://goo.gl/forms/m8hINs9vgwo1Wu6s1

In order to be ready for all the awesome coding and transpiling we will be doing a few things should be installed before we get started.

If you haven't installed Node.js on your machine, or are not running the latest version (8.x.x) please download and install it from here: https://nodejs.org/en/download/current/

After you have Node and NPM (is installed during the Node installation) on your machine, just run the following commands to install two global dependencies that we will need:

npm i -g typescript

npm i -g nodemon

Finally, while this is not required, it is highly recommended that you install Visual Studio Code as it is an excellent editor for Typescript with features like IntelliSense: https://code.visualstudio.com/Download

Graciously hosted by Learn To Program (http://meetu.ps/e/DnlXc/scN7q/d), details to come.

events.name: Mobile Sites Specialist Study Jam (Session 1 of 2)
events.description:
Mobile now accounts for over half of all web traffic. Users expect their small-screen experiences to be as quick and intuitive as those on desktop. But making the mobile web fast and easy takes some special skills.

53% of mobile visitors will leave if a page takes more than three seconds to load. The average page takes 22 seconds to load, so collectively we're losing a lot of mobile users and giving them a bad experience along the way. Speed is only one part of the picture when creating great mobile experiences.

Study Jams are a great opportunity to bring members of your community together to learn something in person. These trainings will give your community members a specific skill they can use for personal development or career advancement.

Together with GDG New Haven, we will work towards earning a professional accreditation that Google offers demonstrate understanding in basic and advanced aspects of mobile website design and development.

Students that complete the exam receive a printable certificate to verify status as a certified mobile sites professional and a Google Partners public profile page listing the certification (see here for details).
events.how_to_find_us: We're on the second floor, suite 206

events.name: Mobile Sites Specialist Study Jam (Session 2 of 2)
events.description:
THIS IS THE SECOND IN A SERIES OF MEETUPS.

IT WOULD HAVE BEEN INTEGRAL TO HAVE ATTENDED THE FIRST MEET UP ON NOVEMBER 30TH, 2017.

---

Mobile now accounts for over half of all web traffic. Users expect their small-screen experiences to be as quick and intuitive as those on desktop. But making the mobile web fast and easy takes some special skills.

53% of mobile visitors will leave if a page takes more than three seconds to load. The average page takes 22 seconds to load, so collectively we're losing a lot of mobile users and giving them a bad experience along the way. Speed is only one part of the picture when creating great mobile experiences.

Study Jams are a great opportunity to bring members of your community together to learn something in person. These trainings will give your community members a specific skill they can use for personal development or career advancement.

Together with GDG New Haven, we will work towards earning a professional accreditation that Google offers demonstrate understanding in basic and advanced aspects of mobile website design and development.

Students that complete the exam receive a printable certificate to verify status as a certified mobile sites professional and a Google Partners public profile page listing the certification (see here (https://support.google.com/partners/answer/7358898?hl=en-GB&ref_topic=7359299) for details).
events.how_to_find_us: We're on the second floor, suite 206

events.name: Making Actions on Google
events.description: We all love coffee right? But making that perfect cup of coffee isn't easy. There's water. There's weight. There's TIME. There has to be a better way! Join us as we create Google Assistant action set to help us make coffee. Coffee will be provided.

events.name: The Integration of Interfaces
events.description:
Are you still unsure what the use of an interface is? Do you know what they are, but you have no idea how to implement them? Why would I bother using them when I could just set and forget classes I create?

Complex functions are much easier to debug with the use of interfaces. Others looking at your code will be able to expand upon your projects with enhanced clarity, and construct from a solid foundation.

Learn secrets of Interfaces... hehehe

events.name: IWD 2018 New Haven (International Women's Day) - Supporting Women In Tech
events.description:
On the 9th of March, GDG New Haven & Checkmate will hold a two hour event targeting the advancement of women in technology in Connecticut from entrepreneurs, developers, designers, etc where you will find a chance to network and take initiative.

Our goal for this event is to kickstart a conversation to leads to collaboration for creating an inclusive culture which blankets our public & private organizations across New Haven.

Agenda:

1) Introduction (5-10 minutes)

2) Local Female Leaders Panel (1 hour)

An open panel conversation where 3 female leaders in our area share their experiences, wants, and needs pertaining to building this community. The audience will be invited to participate in an open setting. Goals of Panel:

-Identify existing pain points
-Unify the room
-Establish immediate next steps & goals as a community
-Identify passionate leaders that take on accountability - who's going to do what?

3) Networking & Refreshments (1 hour)

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
SPEAKER LIST:

Amal Abd El-Raouf

Currently a professor at the Computer Science Department, Southern Connecticut State University, United States. She is a member of the Parallel Processing Group, Information and System Department, Electronic Research Institute (ERI), and a member of the Greater Hartford ACM Chapter. Her research interests include Big Data, Software Engineering, Software Quality, Real Time Systems, Parallel and Distributed Computing, Object Oriented Systems, and Computer Networks. She is the author of several papers in journals and international conferences in the field of Software Engineering. She received her PhD in Computer Science and Engineering in June 2005 from the University of Connecticut and joined Southern Connecticut State University in August 2005.

Margaret Lee

Margaret Lee is dedicated to advancing social entrepreneurship as well as equity and diversity in startups. Before Collab, she was the Co-Director of Marketing at SeeClickFix, a New Haven civic technology startup that brings together neighbors and local government officials. Before that, she worked at the Yale Entrepreneurship Institute (now the Tsai Center for Innovative Thinking at Yale) where she managed the Venture Creation Program and Yale’s summer accelerator, seeing through more than 100 student and faculty ventures. In addition, she helped launch the pilot of the Social Venture Creation Program, an incubation program for social entrepreneurs.

Hibba Meraay - reSET Social Enterprise Trust

Hibba Meraay holds a B.A. from Boston University with a double major in Economics and International Relations. Her passion for economic empowerment stems from her experience as the daughter of immigrants. She brings experience advocating for small businesses through her work in public policy. As a Connecticut native, she is excited to strengthen the entrepreneurship ecosystem in the state. In her free time, she enjoys cooking for friends and cultivating mindfulness.

Randi McCray - phD Candidate in Public Policy

Over the last 15 years she has worked as an employee in IT, but has dedicated a great deal of time to working in non-profit agencies. These experiences led her to pursue an advanced degree in Public Policy and Social Change. As an aspiring policy analyst, her goal is to utilize her research experience, deep understanding of social issues, and understanding of the political sphere to contribute to policy changes that incorporate compromise and multiple paths to achieve policy goals.

events.name: GDG BBQ
events.description:
The weather is getting warmer, the sun is setting later, and the trees have leaves again.

So why not kick off your summer with a great BBQ with your NEW HAVEN GDG. Come join us for complimentary food(Hamburgers, hotdogs, salads), the chance for a great door prize raffle(including a Google Home Mini!!), and some great info from this year's I/O.

We will also be previewing our Devfest for this fall and talking about upcoming events.

Oh, and stickers. There will be stickers.

events.name: DevFest 2018 GDG New Haven
events.description:
TICKETS MUST BE PURCHASED FOR THIS EVENT HERE => https://devfestnh2018.eventbrite.com

TENTATIVE SCEDULE HERE => https://bit.ly/DevFestNH18Schedule

The second annual GDG DevFest New Haven returns on October 27 at Southern Connecticut State University. Join developers, students, teachers, and tech companies for the biggest Google tech conference in New Haven. DevFest New Haven is a community-run, one-day conference aimed at bringing technology enthusiasts and experts together. About 200 people are estimated to attend DevFest, with speakers coming from all over New England and the US. The talks will focus on Google technologies along with other emerging technologies such as Android, Flutter, Firebase, Google Cloud Platform, the Mobile Web, Google Assistant, Machine Learning, and the Blockchain.

DevFest attendees will be able to familiarize themselves with new and emerging technologies, network, socialize, and help to build the growing tech community in New Haven county and Connecticut. Anyone interested in technology is welcome. Each ticket includes talks from industry experts, codelabs and workshops, skill-building sessions, gifts, and lunch. To see an up to date schedule of events, visit https://devfestnh.com

events.name: <FLUTTER> Flutter Live Recap and Viewing Fun Time!
events.description:
There is some big news coming from the Flutter team on the 4th. Join us on the 5th to recap what happened, go over the newest code labs, and re-watch the stream!

There will be food. And good food. Not cheap food.

And swag, if we can order in time.

events.name: Nachos and Code #1: What can you really do with Google Cloud?!
events.description:
So, I got asked the question the other day "What can you do with Google Cloud Platform". At the time I was also looking for a first topic for our new series "Nachos and Code".

Thus this event!

We're going to cover the different offerings from GCP, how to get started with some of the more basic offerings, AND have some nachos!

Also, we'll be giving out a Raspberry Pi Zero!

events.name: [EXTENDED][FLUTTER] I/O 19 RECAP AND FLUTTER HACKATHON!
events.description:
HACKATHON SCHEDULE:

9:30-10:00 - OPENING. TEAMS FORM UP. FOOD.*
10:00-12:00 - HACK HACK HACK
12:00 - LUNCH AND MORE HACKING*
12:00-4:00 - HACK HACK HACK
5:00-5:30 - UPLOAD CODE AND DEMOS
6:00 - PRESENT; CLOSE; VOTE;

FOR ENTRY TO THE DISTRICT: Call Kay at 1 (203) 672‑4810 and tell him you're here for the GDG event, and he will let you inside!

--

So, the dust has settled form Google I/O. That means its finally time for us to get together, watch some talks, discuss some topics, and do a code lab or two.

BUT WAIT! A SUDDEN CHALLENGER ARRIVES!

WE WILL ALSO BE A HUB FOR THE FIRST INTERNATIONAL FLUTTER HACKATHON! FIND OUT MORE HERE --> https://flutterhackathon.com/

Also, the chance to win a Raspberry Pi Zero and some stickers from I/O!

*Food and drink will be provided.

events.name: [FLUTTER] STUDY JAM!
events.description:
So, Flutter is the hot new tech on the block. But you have no idea where to start?! Come find out how to get started with Flutter!

Already know about Flutter? Then come hone your skills.

ALSO, the chance for some fun swag!

OH! And FOOD!

group_profile.intro: CTO is Checkmate. And a madman.
